etymologies: late 16th century: from Greek topikos+ -al. Early use was as a term in logic and rhetoric describing a rule or argument as ‘applicable in most but not all cases’

definitions: (of a subject) of immediate relevance, interest, or importance owing to its relation to current events

examples.text: a wide variety of subjects of topical interest

shortDefinitions: of immediate relevance, interest, or importance owing to its relation to current events

definitions: relating to a particular subject; classified according to subject

examples.text: annotated links to resources in eleven topical categories

definitions: relating to the collecting of postage stamps with designs connected with the same subject.
shortDefinitions: relating to collecting of postage stamps with designs connected with same subject

definitions: relating or applied directly to a part of the body
shortDefinitions: relating or applied directly to part of body

definitions: a postage stamp forming part of a set or collection with designs connected with the same subject.
shortDefinitions: postage stamp forming part of set or collection with designs connected with same subject
